availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson May (Morgan County, 5th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.))

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Prestonburg, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary M. Dawson May in Floyd County, Kentucky, on April 25, 1855. Father of Samuel D. May, James A. May, and Andrew J. May. Attorney in Morgan County in 1860. Captain, lieutenant colonel, and colonel in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from May 26, 1861 to November 14, 1862. Colonel in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) from 1863 to August 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, District 1, p. 107. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Virginia, Tazewell County, Jeffersonville, p. 19. Thomas D. Matijasic, “May, Andrew Jackson” in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 618-619.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994034, Floyd County Marriages.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 110. Find A Grave, "Col Andrew Jackson May (1829-1903)," Memorial #17195866, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17195866/andrew-jackson-may (accessed on July 19, 2018).
